attributes.action: Ban people working when temperature goes over 30C or 27C in a physical job
attributes.background:
Bring in a law were employers have to send home employees when temperature goes over 30C or 27C when working in a physical job

There is no guideline on being sent home if the work place gets too hot, working in a too hot enviroment can cause dehydration and risk of fainting

attributes.action: Close schools when temperature reaches 30 Degrees Celsius.
attributes.background:
Should schools be closed in a heat wave?
Students are forced to remain at school in uncomfortable weather conditions, following their strict school uniform or business wear in sixth forms. These high, uncomfortable weather conditions enable individuals to feeling distracted and lose concentration.
attributes.additional_details:
Teachers also claim that  young individuals can become lethargic and less likely to concentrate. however, within hot weather conditions, students and teachers are also likely to faint.

Schools are due to break up for the summer holidays within the next week, but in the meantime many children are coping with “hot and stuffy” classrooms. And, should be shut within atrocious weather conditions. In addition, some schools do not have air conditioning systems or do not use them as they are costly.

attributes.action: We demand Art. 50 of the Lisbon Treaty be invoked within three months hereof.
attributes.background: On 23rd June 2016, we, the people of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland delivered a mandate, pursuant to the EU Referendum Act 2015, that we exit the EU. We hereby demand that effect be given to said mandate by way of invoking Art. 50 of the Lisbon Treaty within 3 months.
attributes.additional_details:
"I do declare that no foreign prince, person, prelate, state or potentate hath or ought to have jurisdiction, power, superiority, pre-eminence or authority within this Realm." - Bill of Rights, 1689

These words serve to enshrine British sovereignty in its Constitution which remains violated for as long as the UK is a member of the EU. Notwithstanding a mandate to remedy the position by exiting the EU,  PM Ms. May suggests exit will be delayed or worse, not happen at all. This is unacceptable.

attributes.action: Allow encrypted information to be accessed by security services and government
attributes.background: Terrorists and criminals frequently use the Internet and social media to encourage acts of terrorism and criminal activity. If there is a cause for concern, the government and security services should be allowed access to prevent attacks and protect citizens.

attributes.action: Increase tax allowance to £14,976 per year so minimum wage pay no tax on income
attributes.background: We believe this would encourage people back into full time employment whilst reducing benefits claims to a degree. This action may influence our economy as there would be potential for more disposable income.

attributes.action: Allow non resident UK Citizens to also vote on whether the UK Leaves the EU
attributes.background: British people living abroad were NOT allowed a vote and are hugely impacted by the outcome. We form a constituency of people who live a special way of life in the EU - the life that experiences free movement of labour and we well understand free trade benefits. An important voice could not vote.
attributes.additional_details:
I am British, I live in Germany. I have a UK pension, I am likely expected to pay inheritance tax upon death and who knows where I might retire. This decision affects people like me too and we need to have a vote on this matter.
The UK parliament should debate if we are now allowed also a vote which should be integrated retrospectively with the referendum already held, and see how this impacts the referendum result.

attributes.action: Prime Minister suspend 3rd Heathrow runway until Brexit negotiations complete
attributes.background:
Economic case for 3rd runway Heathrow can't be justified until all Brexit negotiations complete & or 2nd referendum.
Under Brexit if carried out, London may no longer retain hub status. If Scotland negotiates to remain in EU, strong economic case Edinburgh & Glasgow become future gateways to Europe
attributes.additional_details:
Assumptions of Heathrow expansion economic projections are based on London being at focal point of connection between UK & other European countries. Logic may now not hold true.
Until full scale of Brexit negotiations are known economic case for 3rd Heathrow runway is tenuous.
If after Brexit negotiations on UK leaving EU, Scotland negotiates to remain part of EU, perfectly conceivable Edinburgh & Glasgow could become significant economic hubs in their own right. Less need for Heathrow expansion

attributes.action: Ban the funding of political parties by any individual, company or organisation.
attributes.background:
Instead, all parties which command a minimum membership, should receive an identical sum from the state for all promotional activities. All eligible parties should be funded by the taxpayer. 

Accepting funding in any form from a third party would become a criminal offence.
attributes.additional_details:
This would ensure that strong leaders with vision become the loudest voices, rather than those with financial backing from vested interests.

The Conservatives would cease to be hijacked by the interest of big business and lobby groups and Labour would cease to be highjacked by the Unions. 

There would be a genuinely level playing field which would encourage radical, positive change.

Only then can we create a political system that is truly representative - and one that we can all be proud of.

attributes.action: Referendums must be clearly won AND not disenfranchise relevant constituents.
attributes.background:
Issues important enough to create referendums should not be won by a simple majority, a clear mandate is required.
Voter Turnout >75% wins with >60%,
Voter Turnout <50% wins with >75% with a sliding scale in between.
AND British Ex-Pats should not be excluded on international issues.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition is only meant to affect future referendums including but not exclusive to a 2nd EU referendum.
Many on both sides of the recent campaign called for the argument to be clearly won, before and after the vote.  Uncertainty, resentment and protest vote factors could be minimized by more definitive results.
Also, more than 2 million British Ex-pats were denied the vote despite life changing implications for them and the intentions of the Queen’s Speech of May 2015 Votes For Life Bill.

attributes.action: Make law all party members are allowed to vote in a party leadership election .
attributes.background: This law will make leadership races more democratic and stamp out gerrymandering.

attributes.action: Create a moveable holiday to coincide with good weather
attributes.background: We all know that the public holidays in the UK are unevenly distributed and usually coincide with periods of very poor weather. We can't blame the government for that, however, we do have the power to change it!
attributes.additional_details:
Instead of having two 'bank' holidays in May, we should designate an alternative one day 'Met Office' day every year. This would not be a day that the Met Office gets to chill out, but a day that is designated at short notice when the 'experts' at the Met Office are confident that we will all be able to light the BBQ and actually make the most of time with family and friends. 

In summary, exchange one of the May Bank Holidays for a moveable holiday to coincide with good weather.

attributes.action: Guarantee the estimated £3.8 million of HLS funding for the New Forest.
attributes.background:
There will be a £3.8 million gap in funding for the New Forest Higher Level Stewardship Scheme for 2019 and 2020 once the UK officially leaves the EU.

The scheme is vital to protecting the New Forest's unique environment. That's why we're calling on the government to continue funding the scheme.
attributes.additional_details:
The New Forest Higher Level Stewardship Scheme is a formal partnership between the Verderers, the Forestry Commission and the New Forest National Park Authority.

It has:
Restored miles of internationally-important habitats for wildlife
Supported the historic practice of commoning, which maintains the unique Forest landscape
Worked to identify & protect historic sites

New Forest Commoners: http://www.nfcda.com/news--meetings.html
Official page: http://www.hlsnewforest.org.uk/hls/site/index.php

attributes.action: Sue the EU via the ECJ for the monies the UK should of had under our old rebate
attributes.background: In 2005, Blair gave up 40% of the UK rebate in return for future reforms of the EU. Since those reforms were never made - we should be refunded the money. Full transcripts of those meetings should be made public to ensure the EU did not persuade blair by offering him help with an EU presidency bid
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/politics/6516753/Tony-Blairs-decision-to-cut-the-EU-rebate-cost-9.3billion-report-shows.html

https://www.google.co.uk/url?sa=t&source=web&rct=j&url=http://forbritain.org/140518_eu_rebate_blair.pdf&ved=0ahUKEwjph9Wk7OfNAhVkJcAKHaF9Cd8QFggjMAI&usg=AFQjCNFmtmQSYDDg_kKTb48fcQY19PZ5ow&sig2=WGvOnpdL7aT0BjfKUkL4zw

attributes.action: We have no right to light. I think people should be entitled to light
attributes.background: I recently asked the local council to cut some trees that block daylight on my property and disabled neighbours nextdoor. I was advised I have no right to light and the law states this.

attributes.action: Change the law on combustion engine assisted push bicycles
attributes.background: In the UK it is the law to register, MOT, tax and insure a push bike with a combustion engine on. There are many kits available to fit to your push bike that range up to 80cc. In many countries they are exempt from registration and insurance with success and I think that the same should apply here.
attributes.additional_details: In countries such as Australia it is almost encouraged to use these vehicles as an alternative to cars. They are easy to use, build and repair, are very economical and cause less pollution than a single person travelling in a car. I believe that similar laws should be in place here to allow oppertunities for people who may not be able to afford or run a car or who wish to choose alternative transport. They will help to reduce city traffic and emissions and help to keep roads clearer.

attributes.action: no income tax on overtime for people who earn £9 per hour or less
attributes.background: many people on low wages find them self having to work over time to make ends meet, so I'm asking that people on a low wage (£9 per hour or less) should not be taxed on over time that they need just to get by each month

attributes.action: Companies should have a tax contribution symbol indicating how much tax they pay
attributes.background: Companies should have a simple to understand visual indicator such as an emoji to tell consumers how much tax they contribute as compared to revenue and how much their ceo is paid in comparison to the income of workers and company revenue/growth.

attributes.action: Make MPs promise to protect certain EU legislation, including workers' rights.
attributes.background: I have never been a fan of the EU. As has been pointed out numerous times it is bureaucratic and its organisation has many flaws. That said I voted to remain because being a member has made the UK a better, fairer country. I fear this being undone and the country going backwards, not forwards.
attributes.additional_details:
17,410,742 people voted to leave the EU in the referendum, but 16,141,241 voted to stay. If slightly over 630,000 had voted differently the remain campaign would have won the vote. Though the wishes of the majority must be accepted, it would be intolerable to ignore the wishes of the remain voters.

If the UK wishes to be an outward looking nation then a public statement must be made by MPs from all parties that EU legislation regarding workers' rights and the environment will be protected.

attributes.action: Declare Richmond park in London, car free Zone
attributes.background:
One of the very few places in London, where Londoners and visitors can enjoy, walking, cycling and generally being close to nature without having to leave London. 

The experience, however, is very much spoiled by increased risk of accidents due to huge number of cars driving around the park.
attributes.additional_details: Declare Richmond park in London, car free Zone. If this is not possible, the park should be car-free at the weekends.

attributes.action: Conduct an Independence referendum for Scotland,Wales and Northern Ireland
attributes.background: We the people living in the UK under HM's government rule after voting on EU regarding referendum demand an Independence referendum for the states of Wales,Scotland and Northern Ireland.People should have the right of such a referendum because after Brexit vote opinions of people are changed.

attributes.action: To force councils to invest revenue from parking fines into parking facilities
attributes.background: It is a well known fact that parking fines generate huge profits for local councils, c.£600million+, but there is no action or interest in reducing the number of parking fines issued to motorists, as this is viewed as a profit generator for all local councils alike
attributes.additional_details:
Councils should be forced to invest the large majority of these funds into parking solutions/facilities i.e. underground car parks in densely populated cities and towns, or road improvements where parking improvements are not feasible.

Any improvements should reflect the requirement for resident, business and visitor parking.

attributes.action: Ensure the Health Secretary is a qualified doctor of medicine.
attributes.background: The current health secretary has no medical experience, which is illogical with regards to the responsibility involved in such a job. He is also known to have supported medical practices with no scientific basis. This highlights clear problems with the way in which the health secretary is appointed.

attributes.action: Reunite Britain with a reformed political system
attributes.background: It is clear that the country is divided. England, Scotland, Wales, N. Ireland and London are seemingly at odds with one another and the Westminster elite are not helping. Let's reform the political system to give a fairer, equal governance and voice to the people of the 'United' Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details:
How? 
1) Devolve more power and money away from Westminster and into the regions.
2) Introduce proportional representation so the electorate have a wider selection of candidates to choose from. Let's eradicate 'wasted' votes.
3) Controversially, introduce compulsory voting. This would force our education sector to be more politically aware and engaging with younger voters.
4) Make electronic voting available to further encourage accessibility.

attributes.action: Take down the government petition site.
attributes.background: Increasingly the government's petition site is being used for more & more frivolous purposes such votes of no confidence in individual ministers and efforts to reverse the result of the EU vote. These petitions are undemocratic in their nature and simply a means to complain having lost an election
attributes.additional_details:
EU Referendum petition:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/131215

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-eu-referendum-36634407

Examples of unnecessary "no confidence" petitions.

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/123469

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/111975

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/121152

attributes.action: Ban redoing referendums
attributes.background: We should not redo referendums

attributes.action: Hold a post referendum opinion poll on key factors before the exit negotiations.
attributes.background: Public opinion and information have been misrepresented in a highly complex question. Public opinion of key facts (Immigration, Economy, Politics, etc.) should be found before any exit negotiations can take place, to ensure accurate and fair representation of the true feelings of the population.
attributes.additional_details:
Evidence of misinterpretation of facts has been shown by those leading the campaigns. Public information and opinion has also been shown to be misinformed, given social media trends (i.e #Regretzit) and search engine results (i.e. What is the EU? / What are the results of leaving the EU?) taking place post the referendum result.

A full and open opinion poll should be carried out to find a better understanding of UK opinion on a wider number of topics involved in the exit debate.

attributes.action: Consider independent representatives in all future referendum campaigns.
attributes.background: For all future referendum campaigns, we would like to see the appointment of independent and impartial representatives debate both sides of the argument (with the budget split evenly).  We feel that by doing this, each sides argument is based on fact and not for political gain.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition has been set up in the wake of the European referendum whereby both sides of the debate contained large degrees of scaremongering and, retrospectively it would appear a number of false statements.

We feel that the clear choice in a democratic society is for independent (non-political) representatives to debate both sides in future (based on facts) and with no bias.

attributes.action:
Reopen negotiations with EU to agree better terms for UK.
Hold 2nd referendum.
attributes.background:
The EU Referendum was based upon the last negotiations, which failed to satisfy the majority of voters.
Nevertheless, so momentous is the decision, the U.K. population deserve the opportunity to reconsider a further, more favourable, revision of our terms of membership in a 2nd referendum.

attributes.action: Start schools later
attributes.background: Make schools start and finish later so students can concentrate better

attributes.action: Co-ordinate a crowdfund of Tata Steel interests in the UK.
attributes.background: The UK is in danger of losing it's Steel industry due to the commercial viability for it's owners, Tata Steel. It is my petition that the UK government negotiate a scrap/asset disposal price from Tata, prepare a crowd-funding campaign for the acquisition and management of these assets.
attributes.additional_details: Furthermore, the crowdfunding campaign should look to raise sufficient additional funds to give a minimum 2 year safety net for the continuation of the business based upon projected revenue streams. For more information on how to support the campaign further please get your friends, employer and any wealthy individuals that you are connected with to visit myopinionpal.com where any funds raised will be used to get more people to support this petition.

attributes.action: Lower prescription charges
attributes.background:
Even being a full time employee, I find £8.20 a lot of money to have to find whilst I also have a family to support.
I understand that something should be paid but I dispute having to pay out all that especially when my health has gone down and have had to have 2 separate prescriptions in 2 weeks.
attributes.additional_details:
The government need to get the charges lowered as before long, prescription payers will rather stay sick then pay out all that money for an NHS prescription.
I also pay my national insurance and would rather pay a little more to have cheaper or free prescriptions as a UK tax payer.
Please join and sign the petition to ask to get the charges lowered or a new method as before long it will be over £10 for 1 item.

attributes.action:
Make July 1st Diana Princess of Wales Day
.....a National Bank Holiday....
attributes.background: 20 years ago we lost this amazing woman and what better tribute to her than making her birthday, July 1st, a national bank holiday to celebrate her life and the joy she brought to millions in this country and around the world......

attributes.action: Ban smacking children in the UK
attributes.background: Britain is now one of just four countries in Europe where smacking remains a legal way of disciplining children. Many studies have demonstrated that smacking has no long-term positive impact on children.  Please sign this petition to defend the basic human rights of our children.
attributes.additional_details:
There are many other, more effective, ways to discipline children that do not involve inflicting physical harm on them. 

Smacking should not be regarded as merely a form of discipline; it is assault and it must not be tolerated in this day and age. It is unacceptable that assaulted adults can go to the police, but assaulted children have no form of recourse.

attributes.action: Stop outsourcing assessments for PIP and make fit for Mental Health sufferers.
attributes.background: The current assessment trivialises common issues like depression and anxiety and does not take these into consideration when deciding these claims. The form and the assessor only consider physical ailments and not how mental ability often prevent physical ability and is tantamount to discrimination.
attributes.additional_details: ATOS Healthcare also often misrepresent an individuals needs and conversations they have had during PIP assessments and this has been well documented in the press and many websites previously. Here are a couple of examples: http://www.disabilitynewsservice.com/new-claims-of-atos-assessment-lies-are-tip-of-a-massive-iceberg/ and http://www.disabilitynewsservice.com/atos-nurse-lied-about-pip-claimant-attending-assessment-alone/

attributes.action: Ensure every local government has homeless shelters and support workers for free
attributes.background: We are a group of Year 10 students at Greenwood Academy in Birmingham. We are trying to help homeless people by making it legal for all councils to have homeless shelters that are available 24/7. We also want to see an increase in funding for support workers who offer valuable advice.

attributes.action: Make advertising in any form a fake job vacancy a serious offence
attributes.background: common practice within recruitment is to invent vacancies (even in some cases naming a real Company) to increase the number of CV's a recruitment agency has on file.  This completely wastes job-seekers time, effort, gives them false hope and distracts them from the real task of getting a job

attributes.action: Halt the rise in Southern train fares until the end of the strikes
attributes.background: The strike by ASLEF and RMT has severely affected the quality of the service on Southern Rail and it could be argued that the price of the rail fare should not be increased until such a time when negotiations between Southern Rail and the Unions reach a close.

attributes.action: Introduce stricter laws & screening on people receiving benefits/social housing
attributes.background: Taxpayers contribute to the upkeep of social housing and benefits system. Many people on benefits abuse the system and many people living in council properties actually let the property out or do not look after / damage the property which then will have to be repaired and paid for by taxpayers.
attributes.additional_details: Experience in construction industry.

attributes.action: The Government immediately brings the Crime and Courts Act 2013 s.40 into force.
attributes.background: Parliament enacted s.40(6) “This section does not apply until such time as a body is first recognised as an approved regulator”. IMPRESS is an approved regulator. Secretaries of State say, ‘The time is not yet right’. Further consultation defies the will of Parliament: an abuse of government power.
attributes.additional_details:
If a TV/radio programme treats you unfairly and/or unwarrantably infringes your privacy, you have a right to complain to the independent Ofcom.  The Press should also be accountable without costs risk to the complainant: but they continue to complain and lobby!
See: IMPRESS http://tinyurl.com/zcy5q36
HackedOff: http://tinyurl.com/jag72kt for positive views and rebuttal of Press claims and the merits of IPSO.
Voices of victims  HackedOff: http://tinyurl.com/j7wuvgk and http://tinyurl.com/zxhvrr3

attributes.action: Cyclists should have legally registered identification plates on their cycles.
attributes.background: This is to enable identification of, and consequences for, cyclists who break road traffic laws and cause minor or major road incidents.
attributes.additional_details: There have been previous attempts to pass such laws but they have been generally tied in with the introduction of proposed insurance and road tax for cyclists.  Most cyclists, however, also own cars and so the concept of paying for road tax and insurance twice is an incredibly controversial one.  In order to keep this proposal straightforward, I am suggesting simply that cycle registration becomes compulsory in the same way car registration is, as a means of identification.

attributes.action: Make the National Living Wage apply to people aged 21 or older not 25 or older.
attributes.background:
Adults in the workplace who are under 25 will be paid 45p less an hour than adults who are 25+ even if they do the exact same job.

A worker under 25 will be paid £810 less a year.
A working adult under 25 has the same bills as everyone else and should be paid the same.
attributes.additional_details: http://m.acas.org.uk/index.aspx?articleid=1902

attributes.action: Provide more help for young people trying to start up their own business.
attributes.background: Early stages of my teen life I was on the roads. However due to participating in some workshops provided by my local youth club it opened up doors for me. After a while I started looking at the big picture and saw my actual potential and decided to start up my own brand. We need more of this.
attributes.additional_details: Young people in today's generation are stereotyped to be thugs, thiefs & bad. These kids face a significant amount of gateways into that lifestyles, but where is the gateway to the successful lifestyle? We make it so easy for our kids to join the roads but so difficult to become a business person.

attributes.action: End the Housing Crisis
attributes.background: We are in a housing crisis and something needs to desperately be done such as these initiatives below;
attributes.additional_details:
Give Bursaries/reduce restrictions on brownfield sites, especially to smaller housing companies; This will allow for more building, with the added benefit of being more sustainable.

That each development must have a specified % of council, affordable,  single-living & various bedroom houses available, so to meet the needs of the whole community.

A law that after a developer has received their planning permission, they have a specified amount of time in which to finish their build.

attributes.action: Introduce ecig workplace regulations to stop discrimination against vaping
attributes.background: Hundreds of workplaces are rightly, making policies to include ecigs. The trouble is that some policies are stating that vaping must be in smoking shelters. It is putting vapers at risk and forcing them off the premises to remain smoke free when the smokers have a shelter.
attributes.additional_details: Vaping is not smoking, therefore vapers should have their own rights and not be discriminated against or put at risk of passive smoking.

attributes.action: Ban the Broadcasting of Animal Abuse for Entertainment on Television
attributes.background: This petition calls for the government to place a ban on the broadcasting on television of animal abuse for the purposes of entertainment. It would not include other reasons - such as for charitable and educational purposes.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for individuals or businesses to own more than 3 houses.
attributes.background: I can understand having second, even third homes but the property market is out of control and will continue to be so given the economic environment we live in. The damage here is to social mobility, community, growing inequality and to people who are low-medium skilled.
attributes.additional_details:
I see no appropriate or logical reason to own multiple (I.e more than 3). There is no justifiable reason that I can see. 

Business will get around this so there will need to be incredibly tight restrictions on commercial properties and a rigorous approach to those looking to bypass the law.

attributes.action: Amend the Trade Union Act 2016 to remove trade union immunity from damages.
attributes.background: RMT & ASLEF have been striking for no discernible aim other than to cause harm to the commuters that use Southern Rail. They have wreaked untold costs upon individuals, families & businesses, yet they have legal immunity from the laws that govern every other person & organisation in the country.
attributes.additional_details:
This advantage that gives unions legal immunity from any claims for damages arising from their behaviour, however destructive, is wrong. Even the government has been taken to court by an individual before being allowed to invoke article 50, yet someone that loses their job because of persistent union action has no recourse to the courts, it is unjust and unfair. 

Unjustifiable strikes must stop, unfair advantages must stop.
 
Please help to get the Trade Union Act 2016 amended and remove the unfair trade union immunity from damages.

attributes.action: Improve the treatment of asylum seekers and immigrants coming to the UK.
attributes.background: We believe that with help and support provided by the state asylum seekers and refugees can become just as much of as an asset to the UK. However, the treatment of these vulnerable individuals can only be changed through a shift in the Government's rhetoric and a change in British attitudes.
attributes.additional_details: Over the years the Government and the UK's attitudes towards asylum seekers and refugees have increasingly become more negative. The rhetoric that is pushed is one that pushes the idea of foreigners being somehow less valuable than those native to this country. We call on the Government to revisit and improve current policy.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to breed dogs without being a registered breeder
attributes.background: It should be illegal to breed dogs unless you are a breeder registered on some sort of national register in order to stop people breeding dogs for the wrong reasons and purely for financial gain. It would also help prevent the horrific treatment and breeding in these 'puppy farms'
attributes.additional_details: A national register of breeders should be produced with them all being regulated my a body of animal welfare officers. Anyone breeding outside of these registers should be prosecuted and liable to an unlimited fine.

attributes.action: The government to legislate that all Local Authorities Provide Public Toilets.
attributes.background: To many Local Authorities are closing Public Toilets,to try and save money caused by the governments cut backs. The people of the UK deserve to have the essential use of public toilets. Local Authorities need to be accountable for this Public Service.
